IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]

comment.text: Mediates electroneutral potassium-chloride cotransport. May be activated by cell swelling. May contribute to cell volume homeostasis in single cells.
Activated by N-ethylmaleimide (NEM). Inhibited by DIOA, bumetanide and furosemide. Inhibited by WNK3.
Homomultimer and heteromultimer with other K-Cl cotransporters.

isoform.name: KCC3a-X2M
isoform.text: Does not differ in the osmotic set point of swelling activation but, activation is more rapid.

isoform.name: KCC3a-S
KCC3a-S1
KCC3a-S2
isoform.text: Does not differ in the osmotic set point of swelling activation but, activation is more rapid.

comment.text: Highly expressed in heart, brain and kidney. Detected at lower levels in skeletal muscle, placenta, lung and pancreas. Detected in umbilical vein endothelial cells. Isoform 2 is more abundant in kidney. Isoform 5 is testis specific. Expressed in the proximal tubule of the kidney (at protein level).
Up-regulated by VEGF. Down-regulated by TNF.

disease.name: Agenesis of the corpus callosum, with peripheral neuropathy
disease.description: A disease that is characterized by severe progressive sensorimotor neuropathy, mental retardation, dysmorphic features and complete or partial agenesis of the corpus callosum.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the SLC12A transporter family.

property.value: Defective SLC12A6 causes agenesis of the corpus callosum, with peripheral neuropathy (ACCPN)
